title: Nyore (1990) Genesis Portion
description: Nyole (also Olunyole, Lunyole, Lunyore, Nyoole, Nyore, Olunyore) is a Bantu language spoken by the Luhya people in Vihiga District, Kenya. There is 61% lexical similarity with a related but different Nyole dialect in Uganda.  The Nyore people border the Luo, Maragoli, and Kisa Luhya tribes.

language.name: Nyore
language.area: Western Province, Kakamega District, above Kavirondo Gulf.
